str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
A lord, master, or prince. Perhaps from deo and posis; an absolute ruler.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To despise, scorn, and show it by active insult, disregard. From kata and phroneo; to think against, i.e. Disesteem.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To be a slave, be subject to, obey, be devoted. From doulos; to be a slave to.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From anti and the middle voice of lambano; to take hold of in turn, i.e. Succor; also to participate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Good action, well-doing, benefiting, kind service. From euergetes; beneficence.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From agapao; beloved.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
This; he, she, it.
